Description: Terracotta figure of a standing man (?) wearing draped garments. Wearing long chiton that reaches the rectangular base. Buff clay. Mould-made and hollow. Lower legs and base only. Traces of white coating. Light brown clay with rare silver mica inclusions.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Rhodian parallels of a male figure found at Kamiros, dated to the early 5th century BC, but following late 6th century types (Higgins 1970, 71, no. 151; no. 251 mid 5th century example).
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DB.049) (Phase 3)
